title: Stronghold fund taps into suburban business parks
text:
A Brisbane fund manager is looking to tap into the growing appetite for higher yielding suburban commercial property, with a new fund that will acquire non-CBD assets in well-established business parks.

The Stronghold Property Precinct Fund has been seeded with two buildings in the Brisbane Technology Park in Eight Mile Plains, acquired for a combined $25 million.

It will aim to deliver annual distributions of around 7 per cent with the fund currently negotiating on a third building and targeting upwards of $200 million in assets under management.

Bruce Anderson: Our investors mainly self-managed super funds.

Stronghold's head of funds management Bruce Anderson told The Australian Financial Review a 7 per cent yield was the lowest return offered by the investment group since launching its first syndicated trust in 2013.

Its currently pays average cash returns of 8.5 per cent on its existing 10 close-ended funds holding a combined $200 million worth of hospitality and business park assets in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane and regional Queensland.
description: The Stronghold fund will aim to deliver returns of 7 per cent from suburban commercial property in well-established precincts.
